item.title: Digitization Unearths New Data From Cold War-Era Nuclear Test Films
item.description: March 16, 2017 - The U.S. conducted hundreds of atmospheric nuclear tests between 1945 and 1962 — and filmed them. A project to digitize those films has changed the analysis of the nuclear explosions themselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - The U.S. conducted hundreds of atmospheric nuclear tests between 1945 and 1962 — and filmed them. A project to digitize those films has changed the analysis of the nuclear explosions themselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/16/520398342/digitization-unearths-new-data-from-cold-war-era-nuclear-test-films

item.title: When Policing And Race Cross Paths In Silicon Valley
item.description: March 16, 2017 - In California, officers undergo cultural diversity and discrimination training, which includes understanding the cultural composition of the state and discussing the impact of racial profiling.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - In California, officers undergo cultural diversity and discrimination training, which includes understanding the cultural composition of the state and discussing the impact of racial profiling. http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2017/03/16/518392185/when-policing-and-race-cross-paths-in-silicon-valley

item.title: McDonald's Tweet Blasts President Trump, And Is Quickly Deleted
item.description: March 16, 2017 - McDonald's says its account was "hacked by an external source." The tweet drew a wide range of responses — from pledges to eat a Big Mac today to calls for a boycott.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - McDonald's says its account was "hacked by an external source." The tweet drew a wide range of responses — from pledges to eat a Big Mac today to calls for a boycott. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/16/520390105/mcdonalds-tweet-blasts-president-trump-and-is-quickly-deleted

item.title: FAA Eases Up On Electronic Devices On Flights
item.description: March 15, 2017 - The FAA is allowing air travelers to use their computers, smartphones and tablets during just about the entire duration of commercial flights. Actual phone calls will still not be allowed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - The FAA is allowing air travelers to use their computers, smartphones and tablets during just about the entire duration of commercial flights. Actual phone calls will still not be allowed. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/15/242277334/faa-eases-up-on-electronic-devices-on-flights

item.title: Woman's Headphones Caught Fire Midflight, Australian Authorities Say
item.description: March 15, 2017 - On a flight from Beijing to Melbourne, a passenger's personal headphones caught fire while she was sleeping, the Australian Transport Safety Bureau says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - On a flight from Beijing to Melbourne, a passenger's personal headphones caught fire while she was sleeping, the Australian Transport Safety Bureau says. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/15/520269673/womans-headphones-caught-fire-midflight-australian-authorities-say

item.title: U.S. Indicts 2 Russian Security Officials Over Yahoo Hack
item.description: March 15, 2017 - The two defendants are officers of the Russian Federal Security Service, or FSB. They were indicted along with two criminal hackers over a 2014 breach involving at least 500 million Yahoo accounts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - The two defendants are officers of the Russian Federal Security Service, or FSB. They were indicted along with two criminal hackers over a 2014 breach involving at least 500 million Yahoo accounts. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/15/520258402/u-s-indicts-2-russian-security-officials-over-yahoo-hack

item.title: Vibrator Maker To Pay Millions Over Claims It Secretly Tracked Use
item.description: March 14, 2017 - The makers of the We-Vibe, which can be paired with an app, don't admit any wrongdoing. But they will pay $3.75 million after allegations that the app was collecting "highly sensitive information."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 14, 2017 - The makers of the We-Vibe, which can be paired with an app, don't admit any wrongdoing. But they will pay $3.75 million after allegations that the app was collecting "highly sensitive information." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/14/520123490/vibrator-maker-to-pay-millions-over-claims-it-secretly-tracked-use

item.title: VIDEO: Nike's New Ad Asks A Question Arab Women Know All Too Well
item.description:
March 14, 2017 - 'What will they say about you?' It's the name of a new Nike ad targeted to Arab women.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/14/519516920/video-nikes-new-ad-asks-a-question-arab-women-know-all-too-well
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: As Braille Literacy Declines, Reading Competitions Held To Boost Interest
item.description: March 13, 2017 - As blind children depend more on technology to help them read, braille is seeming antiquated, with literacy rates at just 10 percent. So now, braille reading competitions are held to keep it in use.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - As blind children depend more on technology to help them read, braille is seeming antiquated, with literacy rates at just 10 percent. So now, braille reading competitions are held to keep it in use. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/13/519983877/as-braille-literacy-declines-reading-competitions-held-to-boost-interest

item.title: Developers Create 'Panic Button' For Immigrants Being Detained
item.description: March 13, 2017 - Natalia Margolis, software engineer at Huge, created an app called Notifica that allows people detained for deportation to send out alerts to family, friends and lawyers with the push of a button.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - Natalia Margolis, software engineer at Huge, created an app called Notifica that allows people detained for deportation to send out alerts to family, friends and lawyers with the push of a button. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/13/520021434/developers-create-panic-button-for-immigrants-being-detained

item.title: Covert Fashion Provides Camouflage Against Surveillance Software
item.description: March 13, 2017 - Hyphen-Labs is a group of women of color who are scientists, engineers, architects and designers who have designed clothing that camouflages against facial recognition software.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - Hyphen-Labs is a group of women of color who are scientists, engineers, architects and designers who have designed clothing that camouflages against facial recognition software. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/13/520021384/covert-fashion-provides-camouflage-against-surveillance-software

item.title: Rise Of Artificial Intelligence Met With Mixed Reaction At SXSW
item.description: March 13, 2017 - From South by Southwest, the optimistic and dystopian visions of artificial intelligence — a technology that is becoming part of our daily lives.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - From South by Southwest, the optimistic and dystopian visions of artificial intelligence — a technology that is becoming part of our daily lives. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/13/520021377/rise-of-artificial-intelligence-met-with-mixed-reaction-at-sxsw

item.title: 'Irresistible' By Design: It's No Accident You Can't Stop Looking At The Screen
item.description: March 13, 2017 - Technology is designed to be addictive, offering gratification that's similar to that of drug abuse or gambling. Author Adam Alter says a new frontier could soon provide another escape from reality.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - Technology is designed to be addictive, offering gratification that's similar to that of drug abuse or gambling. Author Adam Alter says a new frontier could soon provide another escape from reality. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/13/519977607/irresistible-by-design-its-no-accident-you-cant-stop-looking-at-the-screen

item.title: Parent Anxiety, Screen Time And Learning In The Digital Age
item.description: March 13, 2017 - We met with parents to talk about screen time, digital privacy and the role of devices in the classroom. They had a lot of questions, so we asked some experts for answers. Take a listen.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 13, 2017 - We met with parents to talk about screen time, digital privacy and the role of devices in the classroom. They had a lot of questions, so we asked some experts for answers. Take a listen. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/03/13/517510888/parent-anxiety-screen-time-and-learning-in-the-digital-age

item.title: Games Are Taking A Back Seat To Players On Video Game Streaming Sites
item.description: March 12, 2017 - Twitch became a popular site for its constant live streams of people playing video games. Its latest addition is Twitch IRL: Same players, same streams, but without the gaming.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 12, 2017 - Twitch became a popular site for its constant live streams of people playing video games. Its latest addition is Twitch IRL: Same players, same streams, but without the gaming. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/12/514107238/are-taking-a-backseat-to-players-on-video-game-streaming-sites
